pages.text:
Title: Peshkov transducer in superfluid<mml:math xmlns:mml="1998/Math/MathML" display="inline"><mml:mrow><mml:mmultiscripts><mml:mrow><mml:mi mathvariant="normal">He</mml:mi></mml:mrow><mml:mprescripts /><mml:mrow /><mml:mrow><mml:mn>3</mml:mn></mml:mrow><mml:mrow /><mml:mrow /></mml:mmultiscripts></mml:mrow></mml:math>

Abstract: The function of Peshkov transducers in $^{3}\mathrm{He}$ is studied theoretically. Two unexpected findings are reported: (i) No second-sound resonances can be detected if the resonator does not possess a thermal link to the helium bath. (ii) The relative strength of different resonance modes depends sensitively on the position of this thermal link.

Title: Peshkov transducer in superfluid<mml:math xmlns:mml="1998/Math/MathML" display="inline"><mml:mrow><mml:mmultiscripts><mml:mrow><mml:mi mathvariant="normal">He</mml:mi></mml:mrow><mml:mprescripts /><mml:mrow /><mml:mrow><mml:mn>3</mml:mn></mml:mrow><mml:mrow /><mml:mrow /></mml:mmultiscripts></mml:mrow></mml:math>

Abstract: The function of Peshkov transducers in $^{3}\mathrm{He}$ is studied theoretically. Two unexpected findings are reported: (i) No second-sound resonances can be detected if the resonator does not possess a thermal link to the helium bath. (ii) The relative strength of different resonance modes depends sensitively on the position of this thermal link.
